original_definition: 'Submersible multistage water pump' means a multi stage (i > 1) rotodynamic water pump with a nominal outer diameter of 4′′ (10,16 cm) or 6′′ (15,24 cm) designed to be operated in a borehole at nominal speed of 2 900 rpm, at operating temperatures within a range of 0 °C and 90 °C;
generated_definition: 'Submersible multistage water pump' means a water pump with multiple stages, designed to be submerged in water, used for various applications such as irrigation, industrial processes, and domestic use.

Article 2: ‘Submersible multistage water pump’ (MSS) means a multi stage (i > 1) rotodynamic water pump with a nominal outer diameter of 4′′ (10,16 cm) or 6′′ (15,24 cm) designed to be operated in a borehole at nominal speed of 2 900 rpm, at operating temperatures within a range of 0 °C and 90 °C;

‘Submersible multistage water pump’ (MSS) means a multi stage (i > 1)rotodynamic water pump with a nominal outer diameter of 4′′ (10,16 cm) or 6′′ (15,24 cm) designed to be operated in a borehole at nominal speed of 2 900 rpm, at operating temperatures within a range of 0 °C and 90 °C;
Article 8: All efficiencies are based on full (untrimmed) impeller.Vertical multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 3 stage (i = 3) version.Submersible multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 9 stage (i = 9) version. If this number of stages is not offered within the specific product range the next higher number of stages within the product range is to be chosen for testing.

All efficiencies are based on full (untrimmed) impeller. Vertical multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 3 stage (i = 3) version. Submersible multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 9 stage (i = 9) version. If this number of stages is not offered within the specific product range the next higher number of stages within the product range is to be chosen for testing.
